result.execSummary:
The defendant Javaris J Nunn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:04 AM Defendant Javaris J Nunn in court, in custody.  Attorney Allegra L Berry in court for Javaris J Nunn.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 and 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count # 1 to Misd. DC-DV 947.01(1) [973.055(1)]  . 
Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 60 days in Dane County Jail, with Huber; to commence F/W (deemed served)

COUNT # 2
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 60 days in Dane County Jail, with Huber; cc to ct 1 (deemed served)

-Days credit for time served:  45 (6/9/22-6/16/22, 6/29/22-8/4/22)

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1, 2
-DA surcharge
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge and DA surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Bond posted to be applied to fines and cc only and remainder returned to poster.

-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights
